channel.title: CVE Feed for Zoom Video Communications Inc -- Zoom Client for Meetings for MacOS
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Zoom Video Communications Inc -- Zoom Client for Meetings for MacOS

item.title: CVE-2022-28757|2024-08-03T06:03:52.652Z -- zoom%20video%20communications%20inc -- zoom%20client%20for%20meetings%20for%20macos
item.description: The Zoom Client for Meetings for macOS (Standard and for IT Admin) starting with version 5.7.3 and before 5.11.6 contains a vulnerability in the auto update process. A local low-privileged user could exploit this vulnerability to escalate their privileges to root.

item.title: CVE-2022-28762|2024-08-03T06:03:52.685Z -- zoom%20video%20communications%20inc -- zoom%20client%20for%20meetings%20for%20macos
item.description: Zoom Client for Meetings for macOS (Standard and for IT Admin) starting with 5.10.6 and prior to 5.12.0 contains a debugging port misconfiguration. When camera mode rendering context is enabled as part of the Zoom App Layers API by running certain Zoom Apps, a local debugging port is opened by the Zoom client. A local malicious user could use this debugging port to connect to and control the Zoom Apps running in the Zoom client.

item.title: CVE-2022-28756|2024-08-03T06:03:52.633Z -- zoom%20video%20communications%20inc -- zoom%20client%20for%20meetings%20for%20macos
item.description: The Zoom Client for Meetings for macOS (Standard and for IT Admin) starting with version 5.7.3 and before 5.11.5 contains a vulnerability in the auto update process. A local low-privileged user could exploit this vulnerability to escalate their privileges to root.

item.title: CVE-2022-28751|2024-08-03T06:03:52.718Z -- zoom%20video%20communications%20inc -- zoom%20client%20for%20meetings%20for%20macos
item.description: The Zoom Client for Meetings for MacOS (Standard and for IT Admin) before version 5.11.3 contains a vulnerability in the package signature validation during the update process. A local low-privileged user could exploit this vulnerability to escalate their privileges to root.
